message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV 

Reasoning: 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): The paper deals with cross-lingual word embeddings and word alignment, which are both topics within the scope of this sub-category.
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper proposes an unsupervised objective to adapt CLWEs to parallel corpora, which involves machine learning techniques.
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The use of CLWEs and the proposed objective can be seen as a form of artificial intelligence, specifically in the area of natural language processing.
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval): Word alignment is a task that is relevant to information retrieval, as it can improve the accuracy of cross-lingual search and document retrieval.
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): Although the paper does not explicitly mention computer vision, CLWEs have been used in image captioning and other computer vision tasks, so this sub-category could also be relevant.
